item.title: [HBASE-872] Getting exceptions in shell when creating/disabling tables
item.description:

item.summary: Getting exceptions in shell when creating/disabling tables

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I saw that too, pretty easy to recreate. Maybe we should up the waiting time a bit or add some retry logic?
The client pause period was lowered from 5 seconds to 2 seconds as part of HBASE-830. Enable and disable table in HBaseAdmin already has wait and retry logic. Not sure what the shell does exactly.

Making a blocker on 0.2.1

Only pity is that I can't reproduce on machines here – but Daniel Leffel reported this yesterday up on his ec2 cluster.

Dru, since you can reproduce easily, would you mind changing retries to see if that fixes the issue for you?

In bin/hirb.rb, look for:


@configuration.setInt("hbase.client.retries.number", 3)

@configuration.setInt("ipc.client.connect.max.retries", 3)

Try commenting the two lines above out by prefixing the lines with a '#' character. See if that fixes it.

Fixes both problems. First, patch handles more exceptions in createTable by introducing a new parent class for regions handling related exceptions. Second problem isn't really one, the table always gets disabled (after some time) but we exhausted the retries we were given so I just changed to message.
Committed branch and trunk. Thanks for the patch j-d.
